info.name: Commvault Rest API - Powershell copy
info.description:
Welcome
--------------
Welcome to Commvault's Rest APIs.  You can explore our APIs in [Postman](https://getpostman.com) using the predefined requests we created.

Setup
--------------
To get started, [create an environment in Postman](https://www.getpostman.com/docs/environments), select that environment, and set your environment variables by entering necessary values in the `0 - Setup/Environment Setup` pre-request script ([documentation on pre-request scripts](http://www.getpostman.com/docs/pre_request_scripts)).  Also, Some of our calls might have dependencies. `GET`/`PUT`/`DELETE` may only work after an item is created with a `POST`.

[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=45551.htm)

Questions/Comments/Suggestions
--------------
If you have any questions or comments, please let us know at [dev-api@commvault.com](mailto:dev-api@commvault.com).

item.name: 0 - Setup

exec: //set your CS username and password here
// This is a default variable. Please do not change this because all our tests are written based on JSON responses.

request.description:
Add your QSDK Authenticated token to your Postman Environment by providing the details in the pre-request script.

You only need to run this one time because these values are stored in your Postman Environment.

Description

This operation returns a list of agents for a client. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_agent.htm)

Description

This operation updates the properties associated with an agent. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_agent_properties.htm)

response.name: POST Agent Properties - Enables Backup Activity

header.description: The mime type of this content

Description

(starting with V11 RTM) Commvault REST APIs support token-based authentication via the Authtoken request header. The POST Login API is used to retrieve the authentication token. Once obtained, the authentication token must be inserted into the Authtoken header for all requests. Note: The authentication token expires after 30 minutes of inactivity. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/rest_api_authentication.htm)

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no" ?>
<App_PerformClientGroupReq>

  <clientGroupOperationType>Create</clientGroupOperationType>

  <clientGroupDetail>
    <clientGroup>
      <clientGroupName>test_scg</clientGroupName>
      <newName>test_scg</newName>
    </clientGroup>
    <description></description>
    <isEDCInstanceAssociated>false</isEDCInstanceAssociated>
    <isAddinClientGroup>false</isAddinClientGroup>
    <isSmartClientGroup>true</isSmartClientGroup>
    <associatedClients/>
    <clientGroupActivityControl/>
    <clientGroupSecurity/>
    <firewallConfiguration/>
    <overrideHigherLevelSettings>
      <overrideGlobalAuthentication>false</overrideGlobalAuthentication>
      <useLocalSystemAccount>true</useLocalSystemAccount>
      <userAccount>
        <userName></userName>
      </userAccount>
    </overrideHigherLevelSettings>
    <scgRule>
      <op>SCGP_AND</op>
      <rules>
        <rule>
          <op>SCGP_AND</op>
          <rules>
            <rule>
              <propID>3</propID>
              <filterID>108</filterID>
              <propType>SCGP_SELECTION</propType>
              <value><?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><TMMsg_AppGroupSelection><appGroups appGroupId="5" /><appGroups appGroupId="1" /></TMMsg_AppGroupSelection></value>
              <secValue>Files;</secValue>
            </rule>
          </rules>
        </rule>
      </rules>
    </scgRule>
    <webSearchServer>
      <clientName></clientName>
    </webSearchServer>
    <dlpPropertise>
      <enableDLP>false</enableDLP>
      <dlpEnableClientKeys>true</dlpEnableClientKeys>
      <dlpStolen>false</dlpStolen>
      <dlpContents></dlpContents>
      <dlpFilters>**\.edgedrive.cache</dlpFilters>
      <dlpFilters>*.app</dlpFilters>
      <dlpFilters>*.bat</dlpFilters>
      <dlpFilters>*.conf</dlpFilters>
      <dlpFilters>*.dll</dlpFilters>
      <dlpFilters>*.dmg</dlpFilters>
      <dlpFilters>*.exe</dlpFilters>
      <dlpFilters>*.ini</dlpFilters>
      <dlpFilters>*.lnk</dlpFilters>
      <dlpFilters>*.plist</dlpFilters>
      <dlpFilters>*.rc</dlpFilters>
      <dlpFilters>*.tmp</dlpFilters>
      <dlpFilters>.DS_Store</dlpFilters>
      <dlpFilters>.localized</dlpFilters>
      <dlpFilters>~$*</dlpFilters>
      <dlpScanIntervalMins>15</dlpScanIntervalMins>
      <dlpMinFileAgeMins>5</dlpMinFileAgeMins>
      <dlpRMProperties>
        <enableRmDLP>false</enableRmDLP>
        <dlpRmOfflineDays>7</dlpRmOfflineDays>
        <dlpRmNow>false</dlpRmNow>
        <dlpRmContents></dlpRmContents>
        <dlpRmFilters>*.app</dlpRmFilters>
        <dlpRmFilters>*.bat</dlpRmFilters>
        <dlpRmFilters>*.conf</dlpRmFilters>
        <dlpRmFilters>*.dll</dlpRmFilters>
        <dlpRmFilters>*.dmg</dlpRmFilters>
        <dlpRmFilters>*.exe</dlpRmFilters>
        <dlpRmFilters>*.ini</dlpRmFilters>
        <dlpRmFilters>*.lnk</dlpRmFilters>
        <dlpRmFilters>*.plist</dlpRmFilters>
        <dlpRmFilters>*.rc</dlpRmFilters>
        <dlpRmFilters>*.tmp</dlpRmFilters>
        <dlpRmFilters>.DS_Store</dlpRmFilters>
        <dlpRmFilters>.localized</dlpRmFilters>
        <dlpRmFilters>~$*</dlpRmFilters>
      </dlpRMProperties>
      <dlpEnableAutomaticDecryption>false</dlpEnableAutomaticDecryption>
      <dlpUnlockMethod>MANUAL_UNLOCK</dlpUnlockMethod>
    </dlpPropertise>
    <excludeFromSLA>false</excludeFromSLA>
    <slaInterval>0</slaInterval>
    <claQuota>0</claQuota>
    <owner/>
    <associatedStoragePolicies>
      <storagePolicyName>SP1</storagePolicyName>
    </associatedStoragePolicies>
    <createAs>
      <userGroup>
        <userGroupName>master</userGroupName>
      </userGroup>
    </createAs>
    <allowJobsToRunPastOperationWindowEnabled>false</allowJobsToRunPastOperationWindowEnabled>
    <slaCopyRedundancy>0</slaCopyRedundancy>
    <slaCopyFallenBehindDays>0</slaCopyFallenBehindDays>
    <rpoMinutes>0</rpoMinutes>
    <rtoMinutes>0</rtoMinutes>
  </clientGroupDetail>

</App_PerformClientGroupReq>

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Credentials
header.description: Indicates whether or not the response to the request can be exposed when the credentials flag is true. When used as part of a response to a preflight request, this indicates whether or not the actual request can be made using credentials.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Headers
header.description: Used in response to a preflight request to indicate which HTTP headers can be used when making the actual request.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Methods
header.description: Specifies the method or methods allowed when accessing the resource. This is used in response to a preflight request.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: Server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: X-Powered-By
header.description: Specifies the technology (ASP.NET, PHP, JBoss, e.g.) supporting the web application (version details are often in X-Runtime, X-Version, or X-AspNet-Version)

item.description:
Description

REST APIs for Data Cube.

request.description:
Description

This operation returns a list of Index Servers. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/data_cube/r_data_cube_api_get_analytics_engines.htm)

Description

This operation creates a new data source in Data Cube. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/data_cube/r_data_cube_api_post_create_data_source.htm)

response.name: Create a File System Data Source

request.description:
Description

With the GET data sources API, you can view the data that is stored in the data source in Data Cube. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/data_cube/r_data_cube_mining_data_api_get.htm)

response.name: View Data in a Data Source

request.description:
Description

This operation returns a list of all the data sources in Data Cube and their properties. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/data_cube/r_data_cube_api_get_data_sources.htm)

Description

This operation returns the status and information about the latest crawling operation for a data source in Data Cube. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/data_cube/r_data_cube_api_get_data_source_crawl_status.htm)

Description

This operation returns information about the crawling history for a data source in Data Cube. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/data_cube/r_data_cube_api_get_data_source_crawl_history.htm)

Description

This operation returns a list of the JDBC drivers that are available on a specific Index Server. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/data_cube/r_data_cube_api_get_jdbc_drivers.htm)

Description

This operation returns a list of registered CommServe databases. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/data_cube/r_data_cube_api_get_registered_cs_db.htm)

Description

This operation deletes the data source and its content from Data Cube. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/data_cube/r_data_cube_api_post_delete_data_source.htm)

Description

This operation runs a disaster recovery backup job. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_disaster_recovery_backup.htm)

item.name: View Details of a Discussion Id

request.description:
Description

This operation retrieves the details of a discussion on a backed up file or folder on a client computer, based on the discussion ID.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters.
401 Unauthorized The request did not include an authentication token or the authentication token was expired.
403 Forbidden The user did not  have permission to access the requested resource.
412 Precondition Failed Prerequisites are not met. For example, MongoDB database is not installed.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_subclient_file_discussion_by_id.htm)

Description

Commvault REST APIs support token-based authentication via the Authtoken request header. The POST Login API is used to retrieve the authentication token. Once obtained, the authentication token must be inserted into the Authtoken header for all requests. Note: The authentication token expires after 30 minutes of inactivity. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/rest_api_authentication.htm)

request.description:
Description

This operation creates a new folder in Edge Drive based on the GUID of the parent folder.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters or the folder name has some unacceptable characters.
404 Not Found The specified parent folder does not exist.
409 Conflict A folder with the specified name already exists in the same location.

The response body will include the information of the folder that already exists. For example:

<App_FileResourceResponse> <error errorCode="409" /> <fileResource parentGuid="97409005317b4dbd9c138d2fd80a9e50" GUID="be7d714583584307bf00f1de47212b94" directory="1" name="NewFolder" path="\Folder1\NewFolder" /> </App_FileResourceResponse>
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_drive_folder_by_folderid.htm)

exec: tests["Response Body contains folder name"] = responseBody.has("name");

Description

This operation uploads a single file to Edge Drive. The API is used for uploading files that are relatively small in size.

For larger files (greater than 4 MB), upload the files in multiple data chunks. For more information, see Initiate an Upload Session

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required headers or file content in the request body.
403 Forbidden The user does not have rights to upload the file or the upload operation is disabled by the administrator by disabling backup activity from the CommCell Console.
409 Conflict An upload operation is already in progress for the same file. The response body will have the existing requestId and the number of bytes that the web server has already received for the file. Example:

<DM2ContentIndexing_UploadFileResp requestId="13213022088234198160108125214183230586134182" chunkOffset="780830" errorCode="409" />

When a conflict occurs,

  • Use the same requestID to resume a chunk file upload from the byte offset sent from the server by sending data chunks.
  • Use the following URL parameter to force restart the upload of the file from the beginning. If this approach is used a new upload request session will be initiated and response will have the requestID.  Using the new requestID, the file data can be sent from beginning.

    /drive/file/action/upload?uploadType=fullFile&forceRestart=true
413 Request Entity Too Large Upload attempted for a large file (greater than 4MB). For large files, upload the files in multiple data chunks. For more information, see Initiate an Upload Session.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_drive_full_upload.htm)

Description

Use this operation to initiate the upload session for uploading multiple file chunks to Edge Drive. Optionally, you can also send the first file chunk along with the request.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required headers or file content in the request body.

Make sure the parameter values and format in the header request are correct. For example, the header request for file modified time must be specified in UNIX timestamp format (in seconds). Specifying a millisecond value will return an error. Also, the name must be base64 encoded.
403 Forbidden The user does not have rights to upload the file or the upload operation is disabled by the administrator by disabling backup activity from the CommCell Console.
409 Conflict An upload operation is already in progress for the same file. The response body will have the existing requestId and the number of bytes that the web server has already received for the file. For example:

<DM2ContentIndexing_UploadFileResp requestId="13213022088234198160108125214183230586134182" chunkOffset="780830" errorCode="409" />

When a conflict occurs,

  • Use the same requestID to resume a chunk file upload from the byte offset sent from the server by sending data chunks.

    /drive/file/action/upload?uploadType=chunkedFile&requestId="13213022088234198160108125214183230586134182"

  • Use the following URL parameter to force restart the upload of the file from the beginning. If this approach is used a new upload request session will be initiated and response will have the requestID.  Using the new requestID, the file data can be sent from beginning.

    /drive/file/action/upload?uploadType=chunkedFile&forceRestart=true
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_drive_upload_header_request.htm)

request.description:
Description

This operation returns the preview of a file in Edge Drive based on the file ID.

Preview is currently supported for all images and Microsoft Office file types.

By default, you can preview files that have a maximum file size limit of 10 MB. For instructions on changing the file size limit, see Changing the File Size Limit for Preview.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters or the file name has some unacceptable characters.
204 No Content Preview is not available for the file.
403 Forbidden User does not have permissions to preview or the preview is requested for a folder or an unsupported file type.
404 Not Found The specified file does not exist.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_drive_preview_by_fileid.htm)

request.description:
Description

This operation creates a new folder in Edge Drive based on the GUID of the parent folder.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters or the folder name has some unacceptable characters.
404 Not Found The specified parent folder does not exist.
409 Conflict A folder with the specified name already exists in the same location.

The response body will include the information of the folder that already exists. For example:

<App_FileResourceResponse> <error errorCode="409" /> <fileResource parentGuid="97409005317b4dbd9c138d2fd80a9e50" GUID="be7d714583584307bf00f1de47212b94" directory="1" name="NewFolder" path="\Folder1\NewFolder" /> </App_FileResourceResponse>
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_drive_folder_by_folderid.htm)

Description

Use this operation to share a specific file or folder in Edge Drive based on the file or folder path.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters.
404 Not Found The specified file or folder does not exist.
409 Conflict The file or folder is already shared or the specified share name already exists.

The response body will have the shareID of the existing share if the file or folder is already shared. The shareID can be used to update the users/user groups to which the file or folder is already shared. For example:

<App_SharedFoldersResp> <shareInfo> <shareFolder syncWebFolderName="Test" syncWebFolderId="10" /> </shareInfo> <resp errorMessage="" errorCode="409" /> </App_SharedFoldersResp>
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_drive_share_by_path.htm)

body.raw:
<App_ShareInfo sharedToOperationType="2" status="0">
    <browseInfo>
    	<paths path="\DemoShareFolder"></paths>
        <emailInfo dontSendEmail="1" emailMessage=""/> 
    </browseInfo>
    <shareFolder syncWebFolderName="DemoShareFolder"/>
    <sharedTo permission="1" userType="1"> 
        <user userName="admin"/> 
    </sharedTo>  
</App_ShareInfo>

<App_ShareInfo sharedToOperationType="2" status="0">
    <browseInfo> 
        <emailInfo dontSendEmail="1" emailMessage=""/> 
    </browseInfo>
    <shareFolder syncWebFolderName="fromlaptop"/>
    <sharedTo permission="1" userType="1"> 
        <user userName="admin"/> 
    </sharedTo>  
</App_ShareInfo>

request.description:
Description

This operation uploads a single file to a shared folder in Edge Drive. The API is used for uploading files that are relatively small in size.

For larger files (greater than 4 MB), upload the files in multiple data chunks. For more information, see Initiate an Upload Session.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required headers or file content in the request body.

Make sure the parameter values and format in the header request are correct. For example, the header request for file modified time must be specified in UNIX timestamp format (in seconds). Specifying a millisecond value will return an error. Also, the name must be base64 encoded.
403 Forbidden The user does not have rights to upload the file or the upload operation is disabled by the administrator by disabling backup activity from the CommCell Console.
409 Conflict An upload operation is already in progress for the same file. The response body will have the existing requestId and the number of bytes that the web server has already received for the file. For example:

<DM2ContentIndexing_UploadFileResp requestId="13213022088234198160108125214183230586134182" chunkOffset="780830" errorCode="409" />

When a conflict occurs,

  • Use the same requestID to resume a chunk file upload from the byte offset sent from the server by sending data chunks.

    /drive/file/action/upload?uploadType=chunkedFile&requestId="13213022088234198160108125214183230586134182"

  • Use the following URL parameter to force restart the upload of the file from the beginning. If this approach is used a new upload request session will be initiated and response will have the requestID.  Using the new requestID, the file data can be sent from beginning.

    /drive/file/action/upload?uploadType=chunkedFile&forceRestart=true
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_drive_share_full_upload.htm)

item.name: Upload a File in Chunks to Share (1)

request.description:
Description

Use this operation to initiate the upload session for uploading multiple file chunks to the shared folder in Edge Drive. Optionally, you can also send the first file chunk along with the request.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required headers or file content in the request body.

Make sure the parameter values and format in the header request are correct. For example, the header request for file modified time must be specified in UNIX timestamp format (in seconds). Specifying a millisecond value will return an error. Also, the name must be base64 encoded.
403 Forbidden The user does not have rights to upload the file or the upload operation is disabled by the administrator by disabling backup activity from the CommCell Console.
409 Conflict An upload operation is already in progress for the same file. The response body will have the existing requestId and the number of bytes that the web server has already received for the file. For example:

<DM2ContentIndexing_UploadFileResp requestId="13213022088234198160108125214183230586134182" chunkOffset="780830" errorCode="409" />

When a conflict occurs,

  • Use the same requestID to resume a chunk file upload from the byte offset sent from the server by sending data chunks.

    /drive/file/action/upload?uploadType=chunkedFile&requestId="13213022088234198160108125214183230586134182"

  • Use the following URL parameter to force restart the upload of the file from the beginning. If this approach is used a new upload request session will be initiated and response will have the requestID.  Using the new requestID, the file data can be sent from beginning.

    /drive/file/action/upload?uploadType=chunkedFile&forceRestart=true
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_drive_share_upload_header_request.htm)

response.name: POST Upload a File in Chunks to Share (1)

404 Not Found The specified file or folder does not exist.
409 Conflict The file or folder is already shared or the specified share name already exists.

The response body will have the shareID of the existing share if the file or folder is already shared. The shareID can be used to update the users/user groups to which the file or folder is already shared. For example:

<App_SharedFoldersResp> <shareInfo> <shareFolder syncWebFolderName="Test" syncWebFolderId="10" /> </shareInfo> <resp errorMessage="" errorCode="409" /> </App_SharedFoldersResp>
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_drive_share_by_id.htm)

By default, you can preview files that have a maximum file size limit of 10 MB. For instructions on changing the file size limit, see Changing the File Size Limit for Preview.

The response body will include the information of the folder that already exists. For example:

<App_FileResourceResponse> <error errorCode="409" /> <fileResource parentGuid="97409005317b4dbd9c138d2fd80a9e50" GUID="be7d714583584307bf00f1de47212b94" directory="1" name="NewFolder" path="\Folder1\NewFolder" /> </App_FileResourceResponse>

The response body will have the shareID of the existing share if the file or folder is already shared. The shareID can be used to update the users/user groups to which the file or folder is already shared. For example:

<App_SharedFoldersResp> <shareInfo> <shareFolder syncWebFolderName="Test" syncWebFolderId="10" /> </shareInfo> <resp errorMessage="" errorCode="409" /> </App_SharedFoldersResp>

request.description:
Description

This operation uploads a single file to a shared folder in Edge Drive. The API is used for uploading files that are relatively small in size.

For larger files (greater than 4 MB), upload the files in multiple data chunks. For more information, see Initiate an Upload Session.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required headers or file content in the request body.

Make sure the parameter values and format in the header request are correct. For example, the header request for file modified time must be specified in UNIX timestamp format (in seconds). Specifying a millisecond value will return an error. Also, the name must be base64 encoded.
403 Forbidden The user does not have rights to upload the file or the upload operation is disabled by the administrator by disabling backup activity from the CommCell Console.
409 Conflict An upload operation is already in progress for the same file. The response body will have the existing requestId and the number of bytes that the web server has already received for the file. For example:

<DM2ContentIndexing_UploadFileResp requestId="13213022088234198160108125214183230586134182" chunkOffset="780830" errorCode="409" />

When a conflict occurs,

  • Use the same requestID to resume a chunk file upload from the byte offset sent from the server by sending data chunks.

    /drive/file/action/upload?uploadType=chunkedFile&requestId="13213022088234198160108125214183230586134182"

  • Use the following URL parameter to force restart the upload of the file from the beginning. If this approach is used a new upload request session will be initiated and response will have the requestID.  Using the new requestID, the file data can be sent from beginning.

    /drive/file/action/upload?uploadType=chunkedFile&forceRestart=true
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_drive_share_full_upload.htm)

item.name: Preview File in Public Share By Path

request.description:
Description

This operation returns the preview for a public shared file or a file within a public shared folder in Edge Drive based on the file path. Preview is currently supported for all images and Microsoft Office file types.

By default, you can preview files that have a maximum file size limit of 10 MB. For instructions on changing the file size limit, see Changing the File Size Limit for Preview.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters or the file name has some unacceptable characters.
204 No Content Preview is not available for the file.
403 Forbidden User does not have permissions to preview or the preview is requested for a folder or an unsupported file type.
404 Not Found The specified file does not exist.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_drive_publicshare_preview_by_filepath.htm)

response.name: GET Preview File Versions in Public Share By ID

This operation returns the preview of a specific version of a public shared file or a file within a public shared folder in Edge Drive based on the GUID of the file version. Preview is currently supported for all images and Microsoft Office file types.

By default, you can preview files that have a maximum file size limit of 10 MB. For instructions on changing the file size limit, see Changing the File Size Limit for Preview.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters or the file name has some unacceptable characters.
204 No Content Preview is not available for the file.
403 Forbidden User does not have permissions to preview or the preview is requested for a folder or an unsupported file type.
404 Not Found The specified file does not exist.

item.name: Download a File Version from a Public Share

request.description:
Description

This operation downloads a specific version of a file in the Edge Drive public share based on the GUID of the file version. Note: Downloading a shared folder is currently not supported using this operation.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters.
403 Forbidden Error cased due to one of the following reasons:
  • The user does not have access to the share
  • The file requested is not accessible inside the share
  • Download operation is not allowed. This can happen if you attempt to download a folder.
404 Not Found The specified file does not exist.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_drive_publicshare_download_version_by_id.htm)

response.name: GET Download a File Version from a Public Share

item.name: Add Custom Properties to File in a Public Share

request.description:
Description

Use this operation to add new custom properties or modify existing custom properties to individual or multiple files and folders that are shared or resides within a shared folder in Edge Drive based on the GUID of the file or folder.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request Required parameters were not specified correctly or the custom property is not provided in the request body or invalid path inside share.
403 Forbidden Input token does not match or share has expired or User does not have access or editable rights to the share.
404 Not Found GUID provided in request is not found or failed to get share folder details. Share may no longer exist.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_drive_share_custom_prop_by_fileid.htm)

response.name: POST Move File in Share by Path

item.name: View Custom Properties of a File in Public Share

request.description:
Description

Use this operation to list specific or all custom properties of a file or folder that is public shared or resides within a public shared folder in Edge Drive based on the GUID of the file or folder.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request Required parameters were not specified correctly or invalid path inside share.
403 Forbidden Input token does not match or share has expired or the user does not have access to this share.
404 Not Found GUID provided in request is not found or failed to get share folder details. Share may no longer exist.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_drive_public_share_custom_prop_filter_by_fileid.htm)

response.name: GET View Custom Properties of a File in Public Share

item.name: Delete Custom Properties in a Public Share

request.description:
Description

Use this operation to delete the custom properties of individual or multiple files and folders that are shared or resides within a shared folder in Edge Drive based on the GUID of the file or folder.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request Required parameters were not specified correctly or the custom property is not provided in the request body or invalid path inside share.
403 Forbidden Input token does not match or share has expired or User does not have access or editable rights to the share.
404 Not Found GUID provided in request is not found or failed to get share folder details. Share may no longer exist.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/delete_drive_share_custom_property.htm)

item.name: Add Tags to File in Share by ID

request.description:
Description

Use this operation to add your own tags to one or more shared files and folders in Edge Drive based on the GUID of the file or folder. Tag names can be a combination of letters and numbers. Letters are case-insensitive.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request Request is missing required request body or file and folder information is not provided in the request body.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_drive_share_tag_by_id.htm)

response.name: POST Add Tags to File in Share by ID

item.name: List Tags for a File in Public Share

exec: tests["Response Body contains test tag"] = responseBody.has("test_tag");

request.description:
Description

This operation returns the list of tags assigned to a file or folder that is public shared or resides within a public shared folder in Edge Drive based on the GUID of the file or folder .

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The required parameters were not specified correctly or the GUID of the file or folder is not shared or not part of the shared folder.
403 Forbidden Input token does not match or the share has expired or the user does not have access to the share.
404 Not Found The GUID provided in the request is not found or failed to get share folder details. Share may no longer exist.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_drive_publicshare_tag_by_fileid.htm)

response.name: POST Add Tags to File in Share by ID

request.description:
Description

Use this operation to delete tags from one or more shared files and folders in Edge Drive.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required request body or the file or folder information is not provided in the request body or shareId is not specified correctly.
500 Internal Server Error Failed to retrieve the share information.
403 Forbidden Error caused by one of the following reasons:
  • Input token does not match
  • Share expired
  • User does not have access to the share
  • User does not have editable rights to the share
404 Not Found Failed to get share folder details. Share may no longer exist.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/delete_drive_share_tag.htm)

response.name: DELETE Delete Tags in a Share

Use this operation to remove the sharing on a file or folder. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/delete_share.htm)

Description

This operation deletes a file or a folder in Edge Drive using the file or folder GUID.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters.
404 Not Found The specified file or folder does not exist.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/delete_drive_folder.htm)

Description

Commvault REST APIs support token-based authentication via the Authtoken request header. The POST Login API is used to retrieve the authentication token. Once obtained, the authentication token must be inserted into the Authtoken header for all requests. Note: The authentication token expires after 30 minutes of inactivity. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/rest_api_authentication.htm)

This operation allows you to preview a backed up file on your laptop computer. Preview is currently supported for all images and Microsoft Office file types.

By default, you can preview files that have a maximum file size limit of 10 MB. For instructions on changing the file size limit, see Changing the File Size Limit for Preview.

204 No Content Preview is not available for the file.
403 Forbidden User does not have permissions to preview or the preview is requested for a folder or an unsupported file type.
404 Not Found The specified file does not exist.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_file_preview.htm)

request.description:
Description

This operation downloads a backed up file that was shared with you by another user. Note: Downloading a folder is currently not supported using this operation.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters.
403 Forbidden Error cased due to one of the following reasons:
  • The user does not have access to the share
  • The file requested is not accessible inside the share
  • Download operation is not allowed. This can happen if you attempt to download a folder.
404 Not Found The specified file does not exist.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_file_share_download.htm)

Description

This operation returns values for global parameters. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_global_parameters.htm)

Description

This operation returns a list of jobs for a client. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_job.htm)

request.description:
Description

This operation returns a list of jobs for an entity.

Request Parameters

Name

Description

category

Category for which the list of jobs are to be retrieved.

Valid values are:

  • 0, ALL
  • 1, ACTIVE
  • 2, FINISHED

limit

Total number of jobs list that are to be returned.

completedJobLookupTime

List of jobs to be retrieved which are specified
seconds older.

jobTypeList

List of job operation types.

Valid values are:

  • 4, Backup Jobs
  • 14, Synth Full Jobs

response.name: Jobs - Last Completed Full Backup Job
Jobs - Last Completed Incremental Backup Job
Jobs - Last Completed Full Backup Job For a Subclient
Jobs - Last Completed Incremental Job For a Subclient

request.description:
Description

This operation returns the summary for a specific job. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_job_summary.htm)

Description

This opearation returns the details for a job. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_job_details.htm)

Description

This operation kills a job. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_job_kill.htm)

Description

This operation resumes a suspended job. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_job_resume.htm)

Description

This operation suspends a job. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_job_suspend.htm)

Description

This operation returns a list of CommCell events. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_events.htm)

header.description: Specifies the technology (ASP.NET, PHP, JBoss, e.g.) supporting the web application (version details are often in X-Runtime, X-Version, or X-AspNet-Version)

request.description:
Description

Use this operation to create an ObjectStore. Each authorized user can create one ObjectStore. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/put_contentstore.htm)

exec: tests["Response Body contains folder name"] = responseBody.has("name");

request.description:
Description

This operation creates a new folder in the ObjectStore based on the GUID of the parent folder.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters or the folder name has some unacceptable characters.
404 Not Found The specified parent folder does not exist.
409 Conflict A folder with the specified name already exists in the same location.

The response body will include the information of the folder that already exists. For example:

<App_FileResourceResponse> <error errorCode="409" /> <fileResource parentGuid="97409005317b4dbd9c138d2fd80a9e50" GUID="be7d714583584307bf00f1de47212b94" directory="1" name="NewFolder" path="\Folder1\NewFolder" /> </App_FileResourceResponse>
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_contentstore_folder_by_folderid.htm)

exec: tests["Response Body contains folder name"] = responseBody.has("name");

request.description:
Description

This operation creates a new folder in the ObjectStore based on the path to the parent folder.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters or the folder name has some unacceptable characters.
404 Not Found The specified parent folder does not exist.
409 Conflict A folder with the specified name already exists in the same location.

The response body will include the information of the folder that already exists. For example:

<App_FileResourceResponse> <error errorCode="409" /> <fileResource parentGuid="97409005317b4dbd9c138d2fd80a9e50" GUID="be7d714583584307bf00f1de47212b94" directory="1" name="NewFolder" path="\Folder1\NewFolder" /> </App_FileResourceResponse>
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_contentstore_folder_by_folderpath.htm)

exec: tests["Response Body contains folder name"] = responseBody.has("name");

request.description:
Description

This operation returns the properties associated with a file or folder in an ObjectStore based on the file or folder GUID.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters or the file/folder name has some unacceptable characters.
404 Not Found The specified file or folder does not exist.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_contentstore_file_properties_by_fileid.htm)

response.name: GET View Folder Properties by ID

exec: tests["Response Body contains folder name"] = responseBody.has("name");

request.description:
Description

This operation returns the properties associated with a file or folder in an ObjectStore based on the file or folder path.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters or the file/folder name has some unacceptable characters.
404 Not Found The specified file or folder does not exist.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_contentstore_file_properties_by_filepath.htm)

Description

This operation uploads a single file to the ObjectStore. The API is used for uploading files that are relatively small in size.

For larger files (greater than 4 MB), upload the files in multiple data chunks. For more information, see Upload a File in Chunks.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required headers or file content in the request body.

Make sure the parameter values and format in the header request are correct. For example, the header request for file modified time must be specified in UNIX timestamp format (in seconds). Specifying a millisecond value will return an error. Also, the name must be base64 encoded.
403 Forbidden The user does not have rights to upload the file or the upload operation is disabled by the administrator by disabling backup activity from the CommCell Console.
409 Conflict An upload operation is already in progress for the same file. The response body will have the existing requestId and the number of bytes that the web server has already received for the file. Example:

<DM2ContentIndexing_UploadFileResp requestId="13213022088234198160108125214183230586134182" chunkOffset="780830" errorCode="409" />

When a conflict occurs,

  • Use the same requestID to resume a chunk file upload from the byte offset sent from the server by sending data chunks.
  • Use the following URL parameter to force restart the upload of the file from the beginning. If this approach is used a new upload request session will be initiated and response will have the requestID.  Using the new requestID, the file data can be sent from beginning.

    /contentstore/file/action/upload?uploadType=fullFile&forceRestart=true
413 Request Entity Too Large Upload attempted for a large file (greater than 4MB). For large files, upload the files in multiple data chunks. For more information, see Upload a File in Chunks.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_contentstore_full_upload.htm)

Description

Use this operation to initiate the upload session for uploading multiple file chunks to the ObjectStore. Optionally, you can also send the first file chunk along with the request.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required headers or file content in the request body.

Make sure the parameter values and format in the header request are correct. For example, the header request for file modified time must be specified in UNIX timestamp format (in seconds). Specifying a millisecond value will return an error. Also, the name must be base64 encoded.
403 Forbidden The user does not have rights to upload the file or the upload operation is disabled by the administrator by disabling backup activity from the CommCell Console.
409 Conflict An upload operation is already in progress for the same file. The response body will have the existing requestId and the number of bytes that the web server has already received for the file. Example:

<DM2ContentIndexing_UploadFileResp requestId="13213022088234198160108125214183230586134182" chunkOffset="780830" errorCode="409" />

When a conflict occurs,

  • Use the same requestID to resume a chunk file upload from the byte offset sent from the server by sending data chunks.
  • Use the following URL parameter to force restart the upload of the file from the beginning. If this approach is used a new upload request session will be initiated and response will have the requestID.  Using the new requestID, the file data can be sent from beginning.

    /contentstore/file/action/upload?uploadType=fullFile&forceRestart=true
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_contentstore_upload_header_request.htm)

request.description:

request.description:
Description

This operation creates a new folder in the ObjectStore based on the GUID of the parent folder.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters or the folder name has some unacceptable characters.
404 Not Found The specified parent folder does not exist.
409 Conflict A folder with the specified name already exists in the same location.

The response body will include the information of the folder that already exists. For example:

<App_FileResourceResponse> <error errorCode="409" /> <fileResource parentGuid="97409005317b4dbd9c138d2fd80a9e50" GUID="be7d714583584307bf00f1de47212b94" directory="1" name="NewFolder" path="\Folder1\NewFolder" /> </App_FileResourceResponse>
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_contentstore_folder_by_folderid.htm)

Description

Use this operation to share a specific file or folder in an ObjectStore based on the file or folder path.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters.
404 Not Found The specified file or folder does not exist.
409 Conflict The file or folder is already shared or the specified share name already exists.

The response body will have the shareID of the existing share if the file or folder is already shared. The shareID can be used to update the users/user groups to which the file or folder is already shared. For example:

<App_SharedFoldersResp> <shareInfo> <shareFolder syncWebFolderName="Test" syncWebFolderId="10" /> </shareInfo> <resp errorMessage="" errorCode="409" /> </App_SharedFoldersResp>
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_contentstore_share_by_path.htm)

body.raw:
<App_ShareInfo sharedToOperationType="2" status="0">
    <browseInfo>
    	<paths path="\DemoShareFolder"></paths>
        <emailInfo dontSendEmail="1" emailMessage=""/> 
    </browseInfo>
    <shareFolder syncWebFolderName="DemoShareFolder"/>
    <sharedTo permission="1" userType="1"> 
        <user userName="admin"/> 
    </sharedTo>  
</App_ShareInfo>

<App_ShareInfo sharedToOperationType="2" status="0">
    <browseInfo> 
        <emailInfo dontSendEmail="1" emailMessage=""/> 
    </browseInfo>
    <shareFolder syncWebFolderName="fromlaptop"/>
    <sharedTo permission="1" userType="1"> 
        <user userName="admin"/> 
    </sharedTo>  
</App_ShareInfo>

item.name: Upload a File in Chunks to Share (1)

request.description:
Description

Use this operation to initiate the upload session for uploading multiple file chunks to the shared folder in the ObjectStore. Optionally, you can also send the first file chunk along with the request.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required headers or file content in the request body.

Make sure the parameter values and format in the header request are correct. For example, the header request for file modified time must be specified in UNIX timestamp format (in seconds). Specifying a millisecond value will return an error. Also, the name must be base64 encoded.
403 Forbidden The user does not have rights to upload the file or the upload operation is disabled by the administrator by disabling backup activity from the CommCell Console.
409 Conflict An upload operation is already in progress for the same file. The response body will have the existing requestId and the number of bytes that the web server has already received for the file. For example:

<DM2ContentIndexing_UploadFileResp requestId="13213022088234198160108125214183230586134182" chunkOffset="780830" errorCode="409" />

When a conflict occurs,

  • Use the same requestID to resume a chunk file upload from the byte offset sent from the server by sending data chunks.

    /contentstore/file/action/upload?uploadType=chunkedFile&requestId="13213022088234198160108125214183230586134182"

  • Use the following URL parameter to force restart the upload of the file from the beginning. If this approach is used a new upload request session will be initiated and response will have the requestID.  Using the new requestID, the file data can be sent from beginning.

    /contentstore/file/action/upload?uploadType=chunkedFile&forceRestart=true
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_contentstore_share_upload_header_request.htm)

response.name: POST Upload a File in Chunks to Share (1)

item.name: Upload a File in Chunks to Share (2)

request.description:
Description

Use this operation to initiate the upload session for uploading multiple file chunks to the shared folder in the ObjectStore. Optionally, you can also send the first file chunk along with the request.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required headers or file content in the request body.

Make sure the parameter values and format in the header request are correct. For example, the header request for file modified time must be specified in UNIX timestamp format (in seconds). Specifying a millisecond value will return an error. Also, the name must be base64 encoded.
403 Forbidden The user does not have rights to upload the file or the upload operation is disabled by the administrator by disabling backup activity from the CommCell Console.
409 Conflict An upload operation is already in progress for the same file. The response body will have the existing requestId and the number of bytes that the web server has already received for the file. For example:

<DM2ContentIndexing_UploadFileResp requestId="13213022088234198160108125214183230586134182" chunkOffset="780830" errorCode="409" />

When a conflict occurs,

  • Use the same requestID to resume a chunk file upload from the byte offset sent from the server by sending data chunks.

    /contentstore/file/action/upload?uploadType=chunkedFile&requestId="13213022088234198160108125214183230586134182"

  • Use the following URL parameter to force restart the upload of the file from the beginning. If this approach is used a new upload request session will be initiated and response will have the requestID.  Using the new requestID, the file data can be sent from beginning.

    /contentstore/file/action/upload?uploadType=chunkedFile&forceRestart=true
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_contentstore_upload_header_request.htm)

request.description:
Description

Use this operation to share a specific file or folder in an ObjectStore based on the GUID of the file or folder.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters.
404 Not Found The specified file or folder does not exist.
409 Conflict The file or folder is already shared or the specified share name already exists.

The response body will have the shareID of the existing share if the file or folder is already shared. The shareID can be used to update the users/user groups to which the file or folder is already shared. For example:

<App_SharedFoldersResp> <shareInfo> <shareFolder syncWebFolderName="Test" syncWebFolderId="10" /> </shareInfo> <resp errorMessage="" errorCode="409" /> </App_SharedFoldersResp>
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_contentstore_share_by_id.htm)

</App_ShareInfo>

request.description:
Description

This operation returns the preview for a shared file or a file within a shared folder in an ObjectStore based on the file ID.

Preview is currently supported for images and Microsoft Office file types.

By default, you can preview files that have a maximum file size limit of 10 MB. For instructions on changing the file size limit, see Changing the File Size Limit for Preview.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters.
404 Not Found The specified file or folder does not exist.
409 Conflict The file or folder is already shared or the specified share name already exists.

The response body will have the shareID of the existing share if the file or folder is already shared. The shareID can be used to update the users/user groups to which the file or folder is already shared. For example:

<App_SharedFoldersResp> <shareInfo> <shareFolder syncWebFolderName="Test" syncWebFolderId="10" /> </shareInfo> <resp errorMessage="" errorCode="409" /> </App_SharedFoldersResp>
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_contentstore_share_preview_by_fileid.htm)

Use this operation to add your own tags to one or more files and folders within a shared folder in an ObjectStore based on the GUID of the file or folder.

Tag names can be a combination of letters and numbers. Letters are case-insensitive.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The required parameters were not specified correctly or the GUID of the file or folder is not shared or not part of the shared folder.
403 Forbidden Input token does not match or the share has expired or the user does not have access to the share.
404 Not Found The GUID provided in the request is not found or failed to get share folder details. Share may no longer exist.

request.description:
Description

This operation returns the preview for a shared file or a file within a shared folder in an ObjectStore based on the file path.

Preview is currently supported for all images and Microsoft Office file types.

By default, you can preview files that have a maximum file size limit of 10 MB. For instructions on changing the file size limit, see Changing the File Size Limit for Preview.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters or the file name has some unacceptable characters.
204 No Content Preview is not available for the file.
403 Forbidden User does not have permissions to preview or the preview is requested for a folder or an unsupported file type.
404 Not Found The specified file does not exist.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_contentstore_publicshare_preview_by_fileid.htm)

item.name: Add Custom Properties to File in a Public Share

request.description:
Description

Use this operation to add new custom properties or modify existing custom properties to individual or multiple files and folders that are shared or reside within a shared folder in an ObjectStore based on the GUID of the file or folder.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request Required parameters were not specified correctly or the custom property is not provided in the request body or invalid path inside share.
403 Forbidden Input token does not match or share has expired or User does not have access or editable rights to the share.
404 Not Found GUID provided in request is not found or failed to get share folder details. Share may no longer exist.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_contentstore_share_custom_prop_by_fileid.htm)

response.name: POST Move File in Share by Path

item.name: View Custom Properties of a File in Public Share

request.description:
Description

Use this operation to list specific or all custom properties of a file or folder that is public shared or resides within a public shared folder in an ObjectStore based on the GUID of the file or folder.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request Required parameters were not specified correctly or invalid path inside share.
403 Forbidden Input token does not match or share has expired or the user does not have access to this share.
404 Not Found GUID provided in request is not found or failed to get share folder details. Share may no longer exist.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_contentstore_public_share_custom_prop_filter_by_fileid.htm)

item.name: Delete Custom Properties in a Public Share

request.description:
Description

Use this operation to delete the custom properties of individual or multiple files and folders that are shared or resides within a shared folder in an ObjectStore based on the GUID of the file or folder.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request Required parameters were not specified correctly or the custom property is not provided in the request body or invalid path inside share.
403 Forbidden Input token does not match or share has expired or User does not have access or editable rights to the share.
404 Not Found GUID provided in request is not found or failed to get share folder details. Share may no longer exist.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/delete_contentstore_share_custom_property.htm)

item.name: Add Tags to File in Share by ID

request.description:
Description

Use this operation to add your own tags to one or more files and folders within a shared folder in an ObjectStore based on the GUID of the file or folder. Tag names can be a combination of letters and numbers. Letters are case-insensitive.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request Request is missing required request body or file and folder information is not provided in the request body.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_contentstore_share_tag_by_id.htm)

response.name: POST Add Tags to File in Share by ID

request.description:
Description

This operation returns the list of tags assigned to a file or folder that is public shared or resides within a public shared folder in an ObjectStore based on the GUID of the file or folder.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The required parameters were not specified correctly or the GUID of the file or folder is not shared or not part of the shared folder.
403 Forbidden Input token does not match or the share has expired or the user does not have access to the share.
404 Not Found The GUID provided in the request is not found or failed to get share folder details. Share may no longer exist.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_contentstore_publicshare_tag_by_fileid.htm)

response.name: POST Add Tags to File in Share by ID

request.description:
Description

Use this operation to delete tags from one or more shared files and folders in an ObjectStore.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required request body or the file or folder information is not provided in the request body or shareId is not specified correctly.
500 Internal Server Error Failed to retrieve the share information.
403 Forbidden Error caused by one of the following reasons:
  • Input token does not match
  • Share expired
  • User does not have access to the share
  • User does not have editable rights to the share
404 Not Found Failed to get share folder details. Share may no longer exist.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/delete_contentstore_share_tag.htm)

Description

Commvault REST APIs support token-based authentication via the Authtoken request header. The POST Login API is used to retrieve the authentication token. Once obtained, the authentication token must be inserted into the Authtoken header for all requests. Note: The authentication token expires after 30 minutes of inactivity. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/rest_api_authentication.htm)

request.description:
Description

This operation updates associations for client to a plan.

Request Body

"ArrayId" - This is only applicable if using SNAP Plan. "ProcessSubClients" - Applicable if associating all subclients to this plan along with client. Valid values are 1-True, 0-False. "ProcessDefaultSubClientsOnly" - If AppType is provided, then this option is used to determine if only default subclients of provided apptype should be associated with the plan. Valid values are 1-True, 0-False. "IncludeAllAppTypes" - This suggest if all apptypes of client should be expanded with subclients for plan association. Valid values are 1-True, 0-False. "AppIds" - To enable specific AppIds. Valid values are 1-True, 0-False. "AppIds" - Sub Param - Specify apptypes. "IncludeSubClientIds" - Valid values are 1-True, 0-False. "SubClientId" - Subclient Id plan association.

item.description: [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/c_qcommand_rest_apis.htm)

request.description:
Description

Commvault REST APIs support sending QCommands as a request.

  • QCommands:
    • For a list of available CommServe QCommands, see Command Line Interface - CommServe QCommands.
    • For a list of MediaAgent QCommands, see Command Line Interface - MediaAgent - QCommands.
  • QCommands using XML files (qoperation execute):
    • For a list of CommServe XML files, see CommServe XML Files on the Command Line.
    • For a list of MediaAgent XML files, see Command Line Interface - MediaAgent - XML Files.
    • Other areas of the application offer XML files, for example, Command Line Configuration - Virtual Server Agent for VMware. Go to the command line documentation for the specific agent to view the available XML files.
    • For information on creating XML files using Save As Script, see Save as Script Overview.
  • QScripts (qoperation execscript): for a list of available QScripts, see Command Line Operations Using QScripts.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_execute_qcommand.htm)

request.description:
Description

This operation modifies the schedule pattern for a schedule policy. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_schedule_policy_pattern_modify.htm)

Description

This operation creates a schedule policy. [_More Details_](http://docs.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=48814.htm)

Description

This operation associates an entity with the schedule policy. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_schedule_policy_entity_add.htm)

Description

This operation excludes a particular entity such as client,agent,instance,backup set or subclient from the schedule policy. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_schedule_policy_entity_exclude.htm)

Description

This operation adds an agent or agent group to the schedule policy. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_schedule_policy_agent_add.htm)

Description

This operation deletes a schedule policy. [_More Details_](http://docs.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=48866.htm)

This operation removes an entity association such as client group, client, agent, instance, backup set or subclient from the schedule policy. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/delete_schedule_policy_entity.htm)

response.name: Schedule Policy Entity - This operation removes an entity association such as client group, client, agent, instance, backup set or subclient from the schedule policy.

request.description:
Description

This operation adds or removes agent associations on a schedule policy. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/delete_schedule_policy_agent.htm)

Description

This operation adds, excludes, or removes entity associations on a schedule policy. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/put_schedule_policy_entity_assoc.htm)

response.name: Update Schedule Policy Entity Associations - This request associates all default backup set subclients except for the DDBBackup subclient with the schedule policy.
Update Schedule Policy Agent Associations - This request removes the DB2 agent group association from the schedule policy.
Update Schedule Policy Agent Associations - This request associates the DB2 agent group and the SQL Server agent with the schedule policy.

item.name: Powershell Cmdlet
item.description: Commvault Powershell represent operations that are performed in Commcell Console. You can use Powershell commands to create custom interfaces that focus on operatations your user need

item.name: Add-Client
item.description:
SYNTAX

    Add-Client [-ClientName] <String> [-User] <String> [-Password] <String> -AgentType <String> [-SubType <String>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
DESCRIPTION

    Adds a client.

PARAMETERS

    -ClientName <String>
        
        Required?                    true
        Position?                    1
        Default value                
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -User <String>
        
        Required?                    true
        Position?                    2
        Default value                
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Password <String>
        
        Required?                    true
        Position?                    3
        Default value                
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -AgentType <String>
        Value can be VirtualServer
        
        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value                
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SubType <String>
        Value can be - VMware
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see 
        about_CommonParameters (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 

-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
    
    Add-Client -ClientName <ClientName>-User <User> -Password <password> -AgentType <type>
    
    Type Name or ID can be taken from below
    41, Active Directory
    21, AIX File System
    134, Cloud Apps
    37, DB2
    103, DB2 MultiNode
    62, DB2 on Unix
    64, Distributed Apps
    128, Documentum
    90, Domino Mailbox Archiver
    91, DPM
    67, Exchange Compliance Archiver
    53, Exchange Database
    45, Exchange Mailbox
    54, Exchange Mailbox (Classic)
    56, Exchange Mailbox Archiver
    82, Exchange PF Archiver
    35, Exchange Public Folder
    73, File Share Archiver
    33, File System
    74, FreeBSD
    71, GroupWise DB
    17, HP-UX Files System
    65, Image Level
    75, Image Level On Unix
    76, Image Level ProxyHost
    87, Image Level ProxyHost on Unix
    3, Informix Database
    29, Linux File System
    89, MS SharePoint Archiver
    104, MySQL
    13, NAS
    83, Netware File Archiver
    12, Netware File System
    10, Novell Directory Services
    124, Object Link
    131, Object Store
    86, OES File System on Linux
    22, Oracle
    80, Oracle RAC
    130, Other External Agent
    125, PostgreSQL
    38, Proxy Client File System
    87, ProxyHost on Unix
    61, SAP for Oracle
    135, SAP HANA
    78, SharePoint Server
    20, Solaris 64bit File System
    19, Solaris File System
    81, SQL Server
    5, Sybase Database
    66, Unix File Archiver
    36, Unix Tru64 64-bit File System
    106, Virtual Server
    58, Windows File Archiver

item.name: Add-VM
item.description:
SYNTAX

    Add-VM [-ClientName] <String> [-SubclientName <String>] [-EntityType] <String> [-Entity] <String> [<CommonParameters>]
    
DESCRIPTION

    Adds a VM.

PARAMETERS

    -ClientName <String>
        
        Required?                    true
        Position?                    1
        Default value                
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SubclientName <String>
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -EntityType <String>
        Example: Datastore, Folder, Cluster, Host etc if VMware.
        
        Required?                    true
        Position?                    2
        Default value                
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Entity <String>
        Example: Name of the entity. This can be comma separated list
        
        Required?                    true
        Position?                    3
        Default value                
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see 
        about_CommonParameters (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
    
    Add-VM -ClientName <myClient>-SubclientName <testSubclient> -EntityType <VM> -Entity <myVM>
    
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
    
    Add-VM -ClientName <myClient>-EntityType <VM> -Entity <VM1,VM2,VM3>

item.name: Connect-Commserv
item.description:
SYNTAX

    Connect-Commserv -Server <String> -User <String> [-Password] <SecureString> [-Port <String>] [-PSCreds <Object>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
DESCRIPTION

	Connects to CommServ.

PARAMETERS

    -Server <String>
        CommServ name
        
        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value                
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -User <String>
        User name
        
        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value                
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Password <SecureString>
        Password
        
        Required?                    true
        Position?                    3
        Default value                
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Port <String>
        Port if nondefault has been configured to connect webserver
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PSCreds <Object>
        PS credentials object as argument
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see 
        about_CommonParameters (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
    
    Connect-CommServ -Server <server name>-User <user> -Password <pwd> -Port [port]
    
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
    
    Connect-CommServ -Server <server name>-PSCredential <ps credential object> -Port [port]

item.name: Get-ClientProps
item.description:
SYNTAX

    Get-ClientProps [[-ClientName] <Object>] [[-ClientObject] <Object>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION

    Gets the props of a client.

PARAMETERS

    -ClientName <Object>
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    1
        Default value                
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ClientObject <Object>
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    2
        Default value                
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see 
        about_CommonParameters (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
    
    PS C:\>Get-ClientProps -ClientName $clientObject
    
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
    
    PS C:\>(Get-Client -name {{clientName}}).Name | Get-ClientProps
    
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
    
    $prop = Get-ClientProp -ClientName <clientName>
    
    
    $prop.clientProperties[0].AdvancedFeatures //Gets the list of features or packages installed
    
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------

item.name: Remove-VM
item.description:
SYNTAX

    -SubclientName <String>
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -EntityType <String>

        Required?                    true
        Position?                    2
        Default value                
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Entity <String>
        Example: Name of the entity. This can be comma separated list
        
        Required?                    true
        Position?                    3
        Default value                
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see 
        about_CommonParameters (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
    
    Remove-VM -ClientName <myClient>-SubclientName <testSubclient> -EntityType <VM> -Entity <myVM>

    Remove-VM -ClientName <myClient>-EntityType <VM> -Entity <VM1,VM2,VM3>

-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------

          "clientGroupOperationType":Update,
          "clientGroupDetail":{

            "clientGroup":{

            }

              }

                "clientName":"test002"
              }
            ]
          }
        }
